llm.feedback: Remove all non‑line content and collapse the draft into exactly four “Up/Down” lines, each in the required format: **Up/Down | Time window | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %**.  Use canonical handles (ust10y, dxy) and give explicit magnitude ranges (e.g., “10‑15 bp fall” or “20‑30 bp rise”).  Cite IDs only when stating a fact or number (e.g., Fed cut probability 70 % → U21K4ALYQ).  Drop the malformed “Down | 1–2 weeks | 4.23% …” line and any other stray text.  After the four lines, add a single swing‑trade line for ust10y: **Direction | Horizon | Entry | Stop | Target | R/R | Invalidation | Trigger | Probability % | Confidence 0–100**.  Use evidence: entry 4.20 % (current 4.23 % → 10‑15 bp cut), stop 4.30 % (Fed delay), target 4.10 % (10‑15 bp cut), R/R 1:1.5, invalidation Fed delay, trigger dovish Fed minutes (U21K4ALYQ), probability 70 % (U21K4ALYQ), confidence 80.  Ensure every line ends with a single probability and that the trade line contains no extraneous commentary.
